components.name: Push Notifications
components.description: System for sending push notifications to users.

incidents.name: Latency leading to Discord slowness and failed messages

incident_updates.body:
Everything is back to normal and stable.

The root cause here was a deployment of our API system, which contained a bug in some new code that was creating too many database queries against one of our Postgres backends. This query was in the path of sending messages on Discord, which resulted in highly elevated latency on our API cluster and in particular on sending messages.

We rolled back the code and reverted it, and tomorrow engineering will fix the issue and add some more safeguards around the particular part of the database library that caused the issue. (It is a system designed to basically coalesce queries so we can batch them to the database, but unfortunately in this case the batching was broken and we were generating many, many more queries than expected.)
The rollback has been completed, and service should be mostly back to normal.
We have identified an issue with a bad deployment causing too much load on a database. We are rolling this back now.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We're making progress and hope to have more information and resolution soon
We have temporarily disabled searching messages while we investigate an issue with our search servers.
This incident has been resolved.
DMs are partially recovered; we are continuing to monitor recovery
We are monitoring recovery while investigating the cause.
We've identified an issue with some of our Presence services crashing, that is impacting the ability to send DMs. The team is online and investigating.

incidents.name: Issues connecting, sending messages, joining voice, etc

incident_updates.body: The incident is resolved, and people are able to connect and chat on Discord once again. We're working with Cloudflare to understand the root cause of this issue.
A fix has been implemented on Cloudflare's end. We're monitoring recovery now as people reconnect.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We've isolated the issue to an upstream issue with Cloudflare causing API requests and connections to be denied. We're working with them on a resolution and will post updates as we have them.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Increased Lantency for Message Sends / Issues Starting Calls

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
This look to be recovered but we are continuing to monitor.
Message sends have returned to normal but we're still working through issues with starting new calls.
We are currently investigating problems with message sends and ability to start calls.

incidents.name: Some push notifications are not being delivered to Android devices

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.

components.name: Push Notifications
components.description: System for sending push notifications to users.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Push notifications are restored and should be operating normally.
Approximately 35% of push notifications are being delivered and we expect full service restored in the next 15 minutes.
We are continuing to work through the issue and bring our push notification cluster back online. We expect push notifications to be back online within the next hour.
We've identified an issue affecting some percentage of push notifications and causing them to be dropped. We're working on it now.

components.name: Push Notifications
components.description: System for sending push notifications to users.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A test update to one of our services caused an unexpected load increase on the API. The API autoscaled to accommodate and we are now monitoring recovery.
We are currently investigating this issue.
This incident has been resolved.
The third-party response team has addressed the issue we are monitoring service to ensure full recovery.
The response team for our third party service has identified the issue and is urgently working on a resolution.
We are continuing to investigate the issue with our third-party service.

Nitro and Boost subscription renewals, game purchases, and refunds are currently unavailable due to a major outage occurring with our third party tax calculation service. We are monitoring the situation and will provide more information as it becomes available.
This incident has been resolved.
We are currently experiencing difficulty with images loading and are investigating.
